content.text:
[@ev](@8Qee0I/DwI5DHSCi3p5fsl6FyLGArrnDz3ox9qZr5Qc=.ed25519) 

I did see that error! That's what happened when I tried running Scuttlebutt *before* manually deleting indexes. Could you run `ls ~/.ssb/flume/` and see what's in there? I think the only file you'll want in there is `log.offset`, and everything else is a view that (I think?) can be safely deleted.

In case it's useful, I started Scuttlebutt afterward with `ssb server`, so it looked like:

```sh
node ssb.js
ls ~/.ssb/flume/ | grep -v offset | xargs rm -rf
sbot server
```
